definition: to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed
the right to be elected/the right to stand for election

sentences.english: The law deprives criminals of their right to vote.
sentences.chinese: 法律剝奪了罪犯的選舉權。

sentences.english: Every citizen over the age of 21 has the right to be elected to the Knesset .
sentences.chinese: 所有年滿21歲的公民都有議會的被選舉權。

sentences.english: He was disqualified from the election because he did not register on time.
sentences.chinese: 他被取消了選舉權，因他沒有及時登記。

sentences.english: Politician take no interest in eugenics because the unborn have not vote.
sentences.chinese: 政治家對優生學不感興趣，因爲未出生者並無選舉權。

sentences.english: Now gentlemen, pray inform me, in whom is the right of suffrage?
sentences.chinese: 各位先生，請告訴我，選舉權屬於誰？

sentences.english: In three days, this campaign will end. The election is in your hands.
sentences.chinese: 三天後，這次競選就將結束，選舉權掌握在你們手中。

sentences.english: Women were debarred from voting in that country.
sentences.chinese: 當時該國婦女無選舉權。

sentences.english: Article 10 . Women shall enjoy the equal right, with men, to vote and to stand for election.
sentences.chinese: 第十條婦女享有與男子平等的選舉權和被選舉權。

sentences.english: Article 10 . Women shall enjoy the equal right, with men, to vote and to stand for election.
sentences.chinese: 第十條婦女享有與男子平等的選舉權和被選舉權。

sentences.english: Rights of people with the right to be elected and candidates as well are of unique constitutional value.
sentences.chinese: 其中，被選舉權人和候選人的權利有獨特的憲法價值。

sentences.english: Every citizen has a right to vote and to be voted.
sentences.chinese: 每個公民都有選舉權和被選舉權。

sentences.english: Every citizen has a right to vote and to be voted.
sentences.chinese: 每個公民都有選舉權和被選舉權。

sentences.english: In Britain women were enfranchised in 1918.
sentences.chinese: 1918年英國婦女失掉議會選舉權。

sentences.english: The company voted to enfranchise its 120 women members.
sentences.chinese: 公司投票決定給予其120名女職員選舉權。
年滿十八歲者有選舉權。

sentences.english: In Britain, women were given the franchise in 1918.
sentences.chinese: 英國婦女於一九一八年獲得了選舉權。

definition: highest common factor HCF/greatest common divisor GCD
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
ability to make one's own decisions

pinyin: Zhong1 guo2 te4 se4 she4 hui4 zhu3 yi4
